header.title: Programming Paradigms
header.description: Explore Object-Oriented Design Patterns and the shift towards Functional Programming.

oop.title: OOP & SOLID Principles
oop.description: Core concepts of Object-Oriented Programming and design principles.

encapsulation.label: Encapsulation:
encapsulation.description: Bundling data and methods that work on that data within one unit.

inheritance.label: Inheritance:
inheritance.description: Mechanism where a new class derives properties and characteristics from an existing class.

polymorphism.label: Polymorphism:
polymorphism.description: The ability of different classes to respond to function calls with the same name in a way specific to each class.

solidPrinciples.title: SOLID Principles
solidPrinciples.single: ingle Responsibility Principle: A class should have one and only one reason to change.
solidPrinciples.open: pen-Closed Principle: Objects or entities should be open for extension but closed for modification.
solidPrinciples.liskov: iskov Substitution Principle: Objects of a superclass shall be replaceable with objects of its subclasses.
solidPrinciples.interface: nterface Segregation Principle: A client should never be forced to implement an interface that it doesn't use.
solidPrinciples.dependency: ependency Inversion Principle: Depend on abstractions, not on concretions.

creation.title: Creation Patterns
creation.description: Patterns focused on object creation mechanisms.

singleton.title: Singleton Pattern
singleton.description: Ensures a class has only one instance and provides a global point of access to it.

method.title: Factory Method
method.description: Defines an interface for creating an object, but let subclasses decide which class to instantiate.

abstract.title: Abstract Factory
abstract.description: Provides an interface for creating families of related or dependent objects.

builder.title: Builder Pattern
builder.description: Separates the construction of a complex object from its representation, allowing you to create different representations with the same construction process.

structural.title: Structural Patterns
structural.description: Patterns concerned with how classes and objects are composed to form larger structures.

decorator.title: Decorator Pattern
decorator.description: Attaches additional responsibilities to an object dynamically. Flexible alternative to subclassing.

concept.title: Concept
concept.description:
Modern TypeScript & ES: @Decorators.

We annotate classes or methods with `@DecoratorName`. Under the hood, this "wraps" the original class/method with new logic (logging, validation, etc.).

proxy.title: Proxy Pattern
proxy.description: A placeholder to control access (security, lazy loading).

facade.title: Facade Pattern
facade.description: Simplified interface for complex subsystems (Smart Home).

behavioral.title: Behavioral Patterns
behavioral.description: Patterns concerned with algorithms and the assignment of responsibilities between objects.

observer.title: Observer Pattern
observer.description: Lets you define a subscription mechanism to notify multiple objects about any events that happen to the object they're observing.
observer.note: Common in JS: Event Listeners, RxJS, Redux (Flux).

state.title: State
state.description: Lets an object alter its behavior when its internal state changes. It appears as if the object changed its class.

command.title: Command
command.description: Turns a request into a stand-alone object that contains all information about the request.

templateMethod.title: Template Method
templateMethod.description: Defines the skeleton of an algorithm in the superclass but lets subclasses override specific steps.

fp.title: Introduction to FP
fp.description: Programming paradigm where programs are constructed by applying and composing functions.

immutability.title: Immutability
immutability.description: Data is never modified; instead, a new copy with changes is created. This leads to predictable state changes (Redux style).

pureFunctions.label: Pure Functions:
pureFunctions.description: Given the same input, always return the same output and has no side effects.

higherOrderFunctions.label: Higher-Order Functions:
higherOrderFunctions.description: Functions that take others as args.

currying.title: Currying
currying.description: Function taking multiple args to Sequence of functions.
